definitions: alcoholic beverage made by mixing spirits with other ingredients
formal party where cocktails and appetizers are served to guests
combination of different drugs or chemicals administered together for treatment
examples: She ordered a mojito cocktail with fresh mint leaves
The bartender created a signature cocktail for the restaurant
The embassy hosted a cocktail reception for visiting diplomats
They attended the cocktail party in formal evening wear
The doctor prescribed a cocktail of antibiotics and painkillers
The chemotherapy cocktail was adjusted based on patient response

definitions: tropical palm tree that produces coconuts as its fruit
shortened colloquial term for the coconut fruit itself
examples: The coco palms swayed gently in the tropical breeze
They planted coco trees along the beachfront property
Fresh coco water is sold at street markets throughout Asia
She cracked open the coco to extract the white meat

definitions: powdered substance made from roasted and ground cacao beans
hot beverage made by mixing cocoa powder with milk or water
tropical tree that produces cacao beans used to make chocolate
examples: She added cocoa powder to the brownie batter
The recipe calls for unsweetened cocoa and vanilla extract
They warmed themselves with hot cocoa after skiing
Children enjoyed marshmallows floating in their cocoa cups
Cocoa plantations require specific climate conditions to thrive
The cocoa harvest determines chocolate production for the year

definitions: large oval fruit with hard shell containing white meat and liquid
tropical palm tree that produces coconut fruits throughout the year
examples: She cracked the coconut open to drink its refreshing water
Shredded coconut adds texture to the tropical cake recipe
Coconut palms lined the pristine white sandy beach
The hurricane damaged many coconut trees along the coast

definitions: silky protective casing spun by caterpillars during metamorphosis into butterflies
any protective wrapping or covering that encloses something completely
safe isolated environment that shields from outside influences or reality
examples: The silkworm spun its cocoon around itself before transformation
Scientists studied the cocoon structure under electron microscopes
The injured limb was wrapped in a cocoon of bandages
The spacecraft's cocoon protected it during atmospheric reentry
She lived in a cocoon of privilege and wealth
The university campus became a cocoon from real-world problems

definitions: large marine fish found in cold waters valued for food
deliberate imitation or parody intended to deceive or amuse
examples: Fresh cod fillets were displayed on crushed ice
The fishing vessel caught Atlantic cod off Newfoundland's coast
The documentary turned out to be a cod production
He spoke in cod Italian accent for comedic effect

definitions: passage that brings a musical composition to a formal close
concluding section or summary that rounds off a literary work or event
examples: The symphony's coda featured all instruments in triumphant harmony
The pianist played the coda with dramatic flourish
Her retirement speech served as coda to a distinguished career
The documentary's coda updated viewers on subsequent events

definitions: systematic collection of laws or regulations governing conduct
set of programming instructions that tell a computer what to do
system of words or symbols used to represent secret messages
collection of laws and regulations organized by subject matter
examples: The dress code requires formal attire for evening events
Students must follow the school's code of conduct
She debugged the code to fix the software error
The application code needs optimization for better performance
Intelligence agents cracked the enemy's code during wartime
The message was transmitted using a complex code
The building code specifies minimum safety requirements
Lawyers consulted the municipal code for zoning regulations

definitions: opioid drug derived from morphine used to treat mild to moderate pain and coughing
examples: The doctor prescribed codeine for post-surgical pain relief
Codeine cough syrup requires a prescription in most countries

definitions: person who writes and develops computer programs and software applications
healthcare professional who assigns standardized codes to medical diagnoses and procedures
examples: The coder worked late debugging the new feature implementation
Experienced coders can earn substantial salaries in tech companies
Medical coders ensure accurate billing for insurance claims
The hospital hired additional coders to process patient records

definitions: process of arranging laws or rules into a systematic code
act of organizing and consolidating scattered information into ordered form
examples: The codification of civil law took several years to complete
Legal codification ensures consistency in judicial decisions
The codification of company policies improved employee understanding
Her research involved codification of traditional medicinal practices

definitions: process of writing instructions in programming language for computers
assignment of standardized codes to medical diagnoses for billing purposes
systematic categorization of data using predetermined codes or symbols
examples: She spent hours coding the new website features
Coding bootcamps teach programming skills in intensive courses
Accurate coding ensures proper insurance reimbursement
Medical coding requires knowledge of anatomy and procedures
The research team completed coding of all survey responses
Data coding facilitates statistical analysis of qualitative information

definitions: educational system where male and female students attend the same classes and institutions
examples: The university adopted coeducation in the early twentieth century
Coeducation promotes gender equality in academic settings

definitions: numerical or constant factor that multiplies a variable in algebraic expressions
number expressing the ratio or relationship between quantities in scientific measurements
examples: The coefficient of x in the equation is negative three
Students learned to identify coefficients in polynomial expressions
The coefficient of friction determines how objects slide
Engineers calculated the thermal expansion coefficient for steel

definitions: use of force or threats to make someone do something against their will
unlawful pressure that invalidates consent in legal agreements or confessions
examples: The confession was obtained through coercion and intimidation
Political dissidents faced coercion from government authorities
The contract was voided due to evidence of coercion
Coercion nullifies the validity of legal consent

definitions: state of existing together at the same time or place
ability of different groups to live together peacefully despite differences
examples: The coexistence of multiple species maintains ecosystem balance
Archaeological evidence shows coexistence of different ancient cultures
Peaceful coexistence between nations requires mutual respect
Religious coexistence promotes social harmony in diverse communities

definitions: hot drink made from roasted and ground coffee beans
tropical plant that produces beans used to make coffee beverage
informal social meeting where coffee is typically served
examples: She drinks black coffee every morning before work
The barista prepared specialty coffee with intricate foam art
Coffee plantations cover hillsides in Colombian mountains
Arabica coffee plants require specific altitude and climate
Let's meet for coffee tomorrow to discuss the project
The morning coffee break encourages workplace socialization

definitions: commercial establishment that primarily serves coffee and light refreshments
examples: The independent coffeehouse attracted local artists and writers
Students studied at the coffeehouse near campus

definitions: box or chest for burying or cremating a dead body
examples: The mahogany coffin was adorned with brass handles
Archaeologists discovered ancient coffins in the tomb

definitions: person who establishes a company or organization together with others
examples: The tech startup's cofounder managed product development
She served as cofounder and CEO of the nonprofit

definitions: tooth on the rim of a wheel that engages with another toothed mechanism
person who plays a small but necessary role in a large organization
examples: The broken cog caused the entire mechanism to fail
Each cog must align perfectly for smooth gear operation
He felt like just another cog in the corporate machine
Every cog in the organization contributes to overall success

definitions: word having the same linguistic derivation as another word in different language
person related by blood rather than by marriage
examples: English 'night' and German 'Nacht' are cognate words
Linguists study cognates to trace language evolution
DNA testing confirmed they were cognates through maternal lineage
The inheritance passed only to cognate descendants

definitions: mental action or process of acquiring knowledge and understanding through thought and experience
examples: Cognition involves perception, memory, and reasoning processes
Age-related changes in cognition affect decision-making abilities

definitions: state of living together as unmarried partners in intimate relationship
political situation where opposing parties share power in government
examples: Cohabitation before marriage has become more socially accepted
Legal rights during cohabitation vary by jurisdiction
Political cohabitation requires compromise between president and parliament
The period of cohabitation tested democratic institutions

definitions: quality of being logical, consistent, and forming a unified whole
property of waves having constant phase relationship enabling interference
examples: The essay lacked coherence between its main arguments
Narrative coherence helps readers follow complex storylines
Laser light maintains coherence over long distances
Wave coherence is essential for holographic imaging

definitions: act or state of sticking together tightly as unified whole
intermolecular force that holds together molecules of the same substance
examples: Team cohesion improved after the leadership workshop
Social cohesion strengthens community resilience during crises
Water's cohesion creates surface tension allowing insects to walk
Molecular cohesion determines a material's tensile strength

definitions: group of people with shared characteristic or experience over time
group of subjects in longitudinal research study
ancient Roman military unit of about 600 soldiers
examples: The graduating cohort celebrated their achievements together
Each cohort of employees receives different training modules
Researchers tracked the cohort's health over twenty years
The birth cohort study revealed generational health trends
Roman cohorts formed the backbone of legion organization
Each cohort contained six centuries of soldiers

definitions: series of loops formed by winding something in circles
conductor wound in spiral form creating electromagnetic field
intrauterine contraceptive device shaped like a spiral
examples: The snake arranged itself in a defensive coil
She wound the rope into a neat coil
The induction coil generated high voltage for the experiment
Copper coils in motors convert electricity to motion
The doctor inserted the contraceptive coil during the procedure
The coil provides long-term birth control protection

definitions: flat round piece of metal used as money
creation of new word or phrase
examples: Ancient coins reveal information about past civilizations
She inserted coins into the vending machine
Shakespeare coined many phrases still used today
Scientists coin new terms for their discoveries

definitions: coins collectively or the system of metal money
invention of new words or phrases
process of making coins from metal
examples: The nation's coinage underwent decimalization in 1971
Ancient coinage provides insights into economic history
Shakespeare's coinage enriched the English language permanently
Technical coinage helps scientists communicate precisely
The royal mint controlled coinage throughout the kingdom
Coinage debasement led to economic inflation

definitions: remarkable concurrence of events without apparent causal connection
fact of corresponding in nature or time of occurrence
examples: Meeting her old friend abroad was pure coincidence
The detective didn't believe in such convenient coincidences
The coincidence of their birthdays made planning parties easier
Scientists noted the coincidence of solar flares and communication disruptions

definitions: solid carbonaceous material derived from coal used as fuel
carbonated soft drink, especially Coca-Cola brand
informal term for cocaine
examples: Steel production requires high-quality metallurgical coke
The furnace burned coke to generate intense heat
She ordered a diet coke with her lunch
The vending machine dispensed ice-cold coke
Police intercepted shipments of coke at the border
Addiction to coke destroyed his music career

definitions: sweet carbonated beverage originally flavored with cola nut extract
nut of African tree containing caffeine used in beverages and medicine
examples: Children enjoyed cola floats at the birthday party
The restaurant serves various brands of cola
Traditional ceremonies involve sharing cola nuts with guests
Cola nuts provide natural caffeine for energy drinks

definitions: relative absence of heat or warmth in temperature
common viral infection affecting the upper respiratory tract
lack of affection or warmth in behavior or manner
examples: The cold made everyone bundle up in winter coats
Arctic cold fronts bring freezing temperatures southward
She caught a cold and missed several days of work
Children spread colds quickly in daycare settings
His cold demeanor discouraged friendly conversation
The cold reception made visitors feel unwelcome

definitions: episodes of crying and fussiness in healthy infants
severe spasmodic abdominal pain caused by intestinal gas or obstruction
examples: The baby's colic kept parents awake for months
Pediatricians reassured them that colic typically resolves naturally
Horses with colic require immediate veterinary attention
Renal colic causes intense pain from kidney stones

definitions: large stadium or building for sports or entertainment events
specific name of various entertainment venues worldwide
examples: The ancient coliseum hosted gladiatorial contests and spectacles
Modern coliseums accommodate thousands of sports fans
The Los Angeles Coliseum hosted two Olympic Games
Concert tickets for the coliseum sold out quickly

definitions: action of working with others to produce or create something
treasonous cooperation with enemy forces during war
examples: International collaboration advanced scientific research significantly
The collaboration between departments improved project outcomes
Wartime collaboration with occupying forces carried severe penalties
Historical documents revealed the extent of collaboration

definitions: person who works jointly on activity or project with others
person who cooperates traitorously with enemy forces
examples: Research collaborators published their findings in prestigious journals
She acknowledged all collaborators in her book dedication
Wartime collaborators faced trials after liberation
The collaborator provided intelligence to occupying forces

definitions: artwork created by assembling different materials onto a surface
combination of various elements creating a unified whole
examples: The artist's collage incorporated newspaper clippings and photographs
Children created colorful collages from magazine pictures
The documentary presented a collage of historical footage
Her novel reads like a collage of different voices

definitions: main structural protein in connective tissues of animals providing strength and elasticity
examples: Collagen supplements claim to improve skin elasticity
The body's collagen production decreases with age

definitions: sudden falling down or giving way of a structure
sudden complete failure of institution or system
sudden loss of consciousness or physical breakdown
examples: The building collapse trapped dozens of people inside
Engineers investigated the bridge collapse for design flaws
The economic collapse wiped out retirement savings
The collapse of negotiations ended peace talks
She suffered a collapse during the marathon
Heat exhaustion caused his sudden collapse

definitions: part of shirt or garment that fits around the neck
band placed around animal's neck for control or identification
ring or flange on rod or shaft for attachment
examples: He loosened his collar in the summer heat
The dress featured an elegant lace collar
The dog's collar contained GPS tracking technology
Police used special collars to restrain dangerous suspects
The shaft collar prevented lateral movement of components
Engineers adjusted the collar position on the pipe

definitions: bone connecting the shoulder blade to the breastbone also called clavicle
examples: The cyclist fractured his collarbone in the crash
X-rays revealed a clean break in the collarbone

definitions: variety of cabbage with dark green leaves that don't form a head
examples: Southern cuisine features collard greens with smoked meat
She harvested fresh collards from her garden

definitions: property pledged as security for repayment of a loan
descended from same ancestor but through different line
secondary or indirect damage from military action
examples: The house served as collateral for the business loan
Banks require collateral before approving large loans
Collateral relatives have inheritance rights in some jurisdictions
DNA testing confirmed their collateral ancestry
Civilian casualties were dismissed as collateral damage
The bombing caused extensive collateral damage

definitions: critical comparison of texts or data to identify variations
light informal meal
process of assembling pages in correct sequence
examples: Scholars performed careful collation of manuscript versions
Data collation revealed significant statistical patterns
The monastery served a simple collation after vespers
Guests enjoyed a collation of cold meats and salads
Automatic collation ensures proper page order in printing
The copier's collation feature saves manual sorting time

definitions: person with whom one works in profession or business
examples: She consulted colleagues before making the decision
Former colleagues gathered for the retirement celebration

definitions: object valued and sought by collectors for rarity or interest
examples: Vintage toys became valuable collectables over time
The estate sale featured rare collectables and antiques

definitions: item worth collecting due to rarity, condition, or interest
examples: Comic books from the 1960s are highly collectible
The limited edition became an instant collectible

definitions: action of gathering or bringing things together
hobby of acquiring and organizing items of particular type
examples: Collecting evidence took investigators several weeks
Bees were busy collecting pollen from flowers
Stamp collecting remains popular among enthusiasts worldwide
Her collecting focused on nineteenth-century pottery
